Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • Order
  • public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates an order and prints it to a file named "orders.txt". Successive orders are appended to the file until the Application is closed.

    ALERT - the file "orders.txt" will be created with a pathname "database\\orders.txt". This uses windows based filepath format. We apologize if this creates difficulty for non-windows users. Please edit the format of the String assigned to the constant SET_PATHNAME to match your system requirements.

    Order is a utility class and cannot be instantiated.

    Much of this code, particularly the methods related to file opening and writing, is based on snippets from W3Schools, namely:

    https://www.w3schools.com/java/java_files_create.asp

    Since:
    2021 - 07 - 25

    • Method Detail

      • placeOrder

        public static void placeOrder​(java.lang.String aToolName,
                              java.lang.String aSupplierName,
                              int anAmaunt)
        Writes order to "orders.txt". If this is the first order made, "orders.txt" is first created and then written to. Otherwise, an order is appended to "orders.txt"
        Parameters:
        aToolName - Name of a tool being ordered
        aSupplierName - Name of a supplier being ordered from
        anAmaunt - The amount of tools being ordered

      • createID

        public static java.lang.String createID()
        Creates a random 5 digit number
        Returns:
        A random 5 - digit number

      • createOrdersFile

        private static java.io.File createOrdersFile()
        Creates "orders.txt" file in directory specified in SET_PATHNAME. If this method has already created an "orders.txt" in previous application sessions, it will be deleted prior to creating a new "orders.txt"
        Returns:
        A File object constructed with pathname for "orders.txt"

      • addHeader

        private static void addHeader()
        Prints a header to "orders.txt"

      • addOrder

        private static void addOrder​(java.lang.String toolName,
                             java.lang.String supplierName,
                             int amaunt)
        Appends order to "orders.txt" in client-specified format.
        Parameters:
        toolName - Name of tool being ordered
        supplierName - Name of supplier being ordered from
        amaunt - Amount of tools being ordered
